Elements.Name: momentum
Description:
Allows Sonic to gain, lose, and retain speed while running naturally.
Sonic's jump speed limit has been increased, allowing incline jumps to be easier to perform.
Conflicts with 'Retain Velocity When Jumping Up Slopes' HMM code.

Elements.Name: railMomentum
Description: Allows Sonic to gain, lose, and retain speed while rail grinding naturally.
Sonic still has a minimum grinding speed, but it has been reduced.

Elements.Name: chargableSpinDash
Description:
Enables spin charging to determine the spin dash speed. 5 charges = max dash speed.
Due to the charge requirement to dash, holding the spin dash button without charging makes the ability act like a roll in the classic games.
If momentum is enabled, the spin dash will be momentum-based.

Elements.Name: noSpinChargeDecele
Description:
Prevents Sonic from coming to a halt when charging a spin dash in the air.
This makes it act like a normal drop dash, and makes it the recommended way to perform it.
It's recommended to enable the 'Disable Drop Dash' HMM code.
Conflicts with 'Disable Spin Charge Air Deceleration' HMM code.

Elements.Name: modifiedDashGravity
Description: Modifies the spin dash gravity to stop Sonic from staying in the air for too long, making it less overpowered.

Elements.Name: balancedBoost
Description:
Re-balances the boost to account for Sonic's ability to retain speed very well.
The boost lasts much shorter, making it act more like a dash ability. The spin dash, however, lasts much longer.
Infinite boost now lasts for 2 minutes instead of 3. It's recommended to activate infinite boost when facing SQUID.
It's recommended to enable this if the 'Running Momentum' tweak is enabled.

Elements.Name: disableSpinMove
Description: Disables the Lost World ground rolling thing.

Elements.Name: fasterRunning
Description: Makes running without boost less painful.

Elements.Name: cyberAirBoost
Description:
Enables Cyber Space air boost physics (the only good thing about those physics IMO).
This air boost is momentum-based in a way? The faster Sonic was before air boosting, the longer the air boost lasts.

Elements.Name: fixedSlide
Description: Decreases the minimum speed for sliding.

Elements.Name: wallRunEase
Description: Prevents Sonic from coming to an instant stop when letting go of the boost button while wall running.

Elements.Name: slowStart
Description: Starts Sonic off at a lower speed that builds up smoothly to a run.
